characters.name: Media
characters.introduction: As a media person, your role is to capture the truth amidst the chaos of the protest.
characters.currentSituation: The protest is escalating, and there are conflicting reports about the police's actions.

choices.outcome: Your coverage highlights the peaceful nature of the protests, garnering positive media attention.

nextChoices.text: Continue documenting and interview key leaders.
nextChoices.outcome: Interviews with leaders provide deeper insights and help calm tensions.

nextChoices.text: Share your footage with international news outlets.
nextChoices.outcome: International coverage increases global awareness and pressure on authorities.

choices.outcome: Your focus on aggression escalates tensions and puts you in danger.

nextChoices.text: Seek protection from your news organization.
nextChoices.outcome: Your organization ensures your safety, but the focus remains on the conflict.

nextChoices.text: Attempt to mediate between police and protestors.
nextChoices.outcome: Your attempt at mediation is risky but shows a willingness to bridge gaps.

characters.name: Rookie Officer
characters.introduction: You are a new recruit tasked with keeping order during the protest.
characters.currentSituation: Tensions are rising, and you must make quick decisions to maintain control.

choices.outcome: Your calm approach helps manage the crowd effectively and reduces immediate violence.

nextChoices.text: Communicate with protest leaders to defuse tensions.
nextChoices.outcome: Dialogue with leaders helps ease the situation and gain trust.

nextChoices.text: Use non-lethal methods to disperse the crowd.
nextChoices.outcome: Non-lethal methods are effective, and you are praised for restraint.

choices.text: Deploy tear gas to disperse the crowd.
choices.outcome: Tear gas disperses the crowd but escalates the conflict and draws criticism.

nextChoices.text: Retreat and reassess the situation.
nextChoices.outcome: Retreat allows you to regroup, but the damage to relations is done.

nextChoices.text: Continue with more aggressive measures.
nextChoices.outcome: Aggressive measures increase tension and lead to further violence.

characters.name: Veteran Officer
characters.introduction: As a seasoned officer, you are familiar with controlling large crowds, but the situation today is tense.
characters.currentSituation: Protestors are growing restless, and your experience tells you that things could go wrong fast.

choices.text: Use your experience to coordinate with other officers.
choices.outcome: Effective coordination helps manage the crowd and minimizes conflicts.

nextChoices.text: Engage with community leaders to mediate.
nextChoices.outcome: Engagement with leaders fosters understanding and reduces tension.

nextChoices.text: Maintain a defensive stance and control the area.
nextChoices.outcome: Defensive tactics prevent escalation but may seem overly aggressive.

choices.text: Implement more forceful crowd control measures.
choices.outcome: Forceful measures lead to increased violence and damage to public relations.

nextChoices.text: Request reinforcements to handle the situation.
nextChoices.outcome: Reinforcements help, but the situation remains volatile.

nextChoices.text: Attempt to negotiate a truce with protest leaders.
nextChoices.outcome: Negotiations lead to a temporary de-escalation, though tensions persist.

characters.name: Protestor
characters.introduction: You are a protestor fighting for change. The situation is volatile, but you remain committed to your cause.
characters.currentSituation: Tensions between protestors and the police are growing, and the crowd is getting more agitated.

choices.text: Lead the crowd in chanting slogans peacefully.
choices.outcome: Your peaceful approach calms some of the protestors, and the atmosphere de-escalates.

nextChoices.text: Continue to organize peaceful marches.
nextChoices.outcome: The march goes smoothly, and the media covers it positively.

nextChoices.text: Approach police to engage in dialogue.
nextChoices.outcome: Your attempt at dialogue is well-received, and tensions decrease.

choices.text: Encourage the protestors to push forward towards the police line.
choices.outcome: The crowd becomes more aggressive, and clashes with the police become imminent.

nextChoices.text: Take the lead and confront the police directly.
nextChoices.outcome: You confront the police, but the situation escalates into violence.

nextChoices.text: Step back and rethink your approach.
nextChoices.outcome: You step back, allowing tensions to cool slightly.

characters.name: Politician
characters.introduction: As a politician, you must navigate the delicate balance between appeasing protestors and maintaining control.
characters.currentSituation: Public unrest is growing, and your decisions will affect your political career and the nation.

choices.text: Issue a public statement calling for calm.
choices.outcome: The statement reaches the media, and some protestors begin to calm down.

nextChoices.text: Meet with protest leaders for dialogue.
nextChoices.outcome: The meeting is productive, and a path toward resolution begins to form.

nextChoices.text: Increase law enforcement presence to maintain order.
nextChoices.outcome: While order is maintained, public backlash increases against you.

choices.text: Support stronger measures to suppress the protest.
choices.outcome: Your support for suppression escalates tensions, and your popularity takes a hit.

nextChoices.text: Defend your actions in a press conference.
nextChoices.outcome: Your press conference manages to regain some public trust, but tensions remain high.

nextChoices.text: Reach out to opposition leaders for a compromise.
nextChoices.outcome: The compromise helps ease the tensions and paints you as a peacemaker.
